p: A similar strategy has also been applied to distribute the 18.136 billion poultry birds to 1,315 poultry agents as shown in TableÂ 8.1. All the waterfowl agents have equal radius as determined from the grid size of the gridded poultry data obtained from GLiPHA ( 2007). However, the poultry population represented by each agent varies depending on the world region being modeled by the agent. Note that our Eco-description includes only a selected subset of the waterfowl as complete migration data is unavailable. However, to the best of our knowledge, it is the most comprehensive model of its kind reported to date. Furthermore, it can be readily extended to include additional waterfowl entities from other parts of the world.
